title: Watch, "Manufacturer: Western Clock Co., Ltd. (Merged with Seth Thomas Clock Company in 1931)", ca. 1933
dimensions: Overall: 7 di. x 1.3 d cm (2 3/4 x 1/2 in.)
creditline: Gift of Max Pine and Lois Mander
description: Circular form; smooth black case surrounding brass(?) band with white numerals encircling white face with black hands; brass(?) stem at top.
justification:
from acquisition file: 
The Handbag Watch, which retailed for $2.95, was first available in 1933 and was availabel in black, white, blue, and red Bakelite. The watch also came with a brass display stand. The case was designed by DeVaulchier & Blow, NY. In 1935 the Handbag Watch won the Kaufman award at the Industrial Arts Exposition at Rockefeller Center in New York. PDDA has a few clocks from this period, so this example of a timepiece is of great interest for function (serving as either a watch or clock), and for the use of Bakelite as a case material, exemplifying the simple. bold, often colorful, geometric forms of the Art Deco mode.

tombstone.epitaph: Watch, "Manufacturer: Western Clock Co., Ltd. (Merged with Seth Thomas Clock Company in 1931)", ca. 1933.Bakelite, metal, glass. Gift of Max Pine and Lois Mander. 2008-9-14.
